positive.review:
I have been playing this game on an All In One PC from 2016, Being an AiO prevents me from being able to upgrade a single thing which forces me to play on low graphics and show self control with mods (as not even the disk space is upgradable).

With that said, I absolutely love this game and cannot wait to play it on a much better PC. 

I have learned so much about the farming life. Obviously I understand it's only to an extent, but I've learned a lot about the machinery, what it's used for and how to use it. It taught me what goes into growing an awesome crop and what goes into harvesting that crop. 

Even on low graphics, the visuals are amazing. I'm running an i5 with an integrated graphics card that is simply garbage and 8gb of RAM. 

I absolutely recommend this game to anyone interested in the farming life.

FS22 is a great game at its core. It has all the aspects of farming you would want. However, there are a number of what feels like "lazy spots" in the game, such as a garbage selection of vehicles and equipment for things such as grapes, olives, cotton, beets, and potatoes. Bigger headers are absolutely necessary to make it more bearable, and only have 1-2 options for equipment in general for a number of them seems silly.
Awesome game if you are into roleplaying or farming just know that it is super hard to find good mods that work outside of the respatory mods.
i love this game so much i have been playing since 17 on the phone now i play on xbox and pc it is great

Yes!! I have been a fan since FS19, but I found a bug in the game.  When in Erlangrat running as Farm Manager I started experiencing problems.  One when I was out of a vehicle my character randomly started jumping, two while on land in one of my fields my Tractor and Cultivator disappeared under ground, and when I exited I noticed my screen flickering and flashing a lot.  When I logged out of the game and logged back into the zone Erlangrat my character was doing the same thing.  Finally when I exited my vehicle there was bouncing of the vehicle and fertilizer happening.  

Mac detaile:
Apple M1 Max
32 GB of memory
1TB Drive
Running MacOS Tahoe 26.1
With a fresh install of Steam

The game as a whole? I would say 7/10. Now- the three things that prevent it from being a 10. Firstly- the graphics engine feels extremely dated, and has a tendency to stutter for the first few minutes playing a save, next the entire game feels like there's a thin coat of petroleum jelly over the graphics, honestly I would say FS19 had better graphics, just because they didn't have the absolute garbage TAA this game has. Finally- the near-requirement to either print out the manual or a bunch of cheatsheets can make things tough for someone getting started. However, if you can get past/mod these things away, you're in for hours of pleasurable farming.
So relaxing, just tilling the soil, raising animals or felling trees...
It is a good game, just not some peoples type. I have to be in the mood to play it, but other than that its just outdated and I'm only still playing it because for some reason FS25 wont work.
Great realistic farming sim, very fun and easy to download mods
Great game.  Loads of fun.  600+ hours on this game and there's still plenty to do.
this game is a great way to spend time on a rainy day. U can do whatever u want from farming, logging, and even taking care of animals. There is so much to do in this game. 5 stars

Farming Simulator 22 is a relaxing and detailed farming game where you manage your own fields, vehicles, and production chains. The game offers a wide variety of crops, machines, and tools, giving you plenty of freedom in how you run your farm.

The graphics and weather system look great, and the seasonal cycle adds a nice layer of strategy. Whether you're harvesting crops, raising animals, or expanding your business, the gameplay feels calm and satisfying.

There’s also multiplayer, which makes farming with friends more fun and efficient.

If you enjoy slow-paced simulation games and long-term progression, FS22 is a great choice with tons of content.

fun game, love doing start from zero servers where you have a truck, chainsaw, and a piece of land to biuld your farm.
great game. i just think it needs more older tractors and equipment
it is pretty realistic game and it cant be but overall it is good
it is very easy to run very fun game i have a i5 2500 and a gtx970 so if your worried about it not running dont be

I’ve spent a ton of hours on Farming Simulator 22, and it’s been a really chill and fun experience — especially when playing with friends. There’s something relaxing about building up your farm, managing equipment, and watching your fields come to life over time.

The variety of vehicles and tools is impressive, and the game gives you a lot of freedom in how you want to run your farm. It can be a bit of a grind at times, and there’s definitely a learning curve if you’re new, but once things click, it’s super satisfying.

Multiplayer is where this game really shines. Working together, dividing up tasks, and expanding your farms as a group makes the time fly by.

Overall, Farming Simulator 22 isn’t perfect — it has its slow moments and some clunky mechanics — but it’s a solid, relaxing game that’s easy to lose hours in. 7/10

it's basically the same as fs25 and cheaper
but a great game i strongly recommend it

really fun game would 10/10 recommend. It really sucks you in and time flys by so fast. Its hard at first and then gets more easy as you play. i've only had it for 2 days and now and played roughly 6 hours each day.
Amazing game with friends, however I doubt it would be very fun alone, as I spend 75% of my time just talking, while I drive up and down the field with my tractor.
grow crops crash tractor harvest crops crash combine , great game 10\10

It's fun if you have a pedal and steering wheel. You can do it with mouse and keyboard but you will ache for change soon enough. Game play wise the industries are a nice addition to the base loop of either grow and sell crops or raise animals and sell their products. Overall would recommend any game in the series post FS17!
This is so much fun to play! I really enjoy it. I grew up on a farm and it really takes me back. Great Sim!!! Worth Buying!!
I still like to play this game every now and then. Easy to do what you want, plenty of mods available. And if you want you can run your own gameserver
Its very fun. Lots of vehicles to choose from, and the graphics are really good.
Nice game, I don't have much to say about this game, I collect the Fs game franchise from Fs17 (also having the CD case) and I want to buy 25! I recommend!

I have stopped playing violent and destructive games because of how they desensitize us to violence and loss of life. So I am a big fan of games that are creative (vs destructive), open world, and allow you a lot of freedom to set things up and customize how you want. And there is a lot of that in Farming Simulator. I am glad to see a game like this be successful.
played this once and refunded it. and until this day, i regret refunding it
Love farming? This ain't the game for you. This is a game for you to jump in and mess around with friends/ 10/10 would play again
kinda boring game startup game play for 1 hour get bored and dont play it for a ling time repeat cycle
you need to get this game the mods are free its the best game ive ever played you shood allso get the game raft that is almost just as good and its not much moola

I can farm without doing the hassle in real life
Easy 10/10, I also learned a few things about agriculture. The only thing I don't like is manipulating with the forklift and it would be great to have an option to own a cat (or more) at the farm too
unloading bales with front end tractor forks is still a problem to be fixed
This shit so fire i lost track of time and played 9 hours definentley worth the 20 bucks

Great game imo if you like farming simulators. Id give it a 4/5 stars because ultimaley the grind is gonna suck hours for almost nothing and now that farming sim 25 is the same price your better off buying that, the Ai helpers are actually just flat out special, they get stuck on random things. If they were gonna update these games the Ai is the biggest problem by far. Graphics are decent nothing mind blowing. I wish the AI could actually follow your combine and i don't imagine im the only one who would apprectiate that feature. The AI when i had it do contract work drove into a river leaving the contract 82% done. Kinda boring for normal people. Also your limited on map choice and honestly the mod maps aren't anything that catch my eye the first map is the only good one IMO the other two are near impossible to work on and im personally a fan of big scale farming and i was disaposinted that all the big maps break the Ai causing them to sit there draining money. Overall pretty decent game. But get FS25 if you really wanna spend the money.

fix the logging .. its not synchronised between players online .. lots of times trees / logs don't appear at player A or B  or C .. or they are only visible to 1 of them,. can't be picked up by others ...

Are American drivers realy as bad as they are dipicted on Farming Simulator 22? The AI cars never stop at stop signs, they get in the outside lane and then at the last minute try to turn right, cutting across any traffic in the inside lane. On the plus side, the cars drive at a more normal speed instead of crawling around at 18 mph as on FS17.

negative.review: Countless bugs and unfinished game functionality plague what would have otherwise been a great game. The company has just gotten sloppier with their game quality with every major release of this game. I won't be buying any future releases.

Giants Software are lazy, Money grabbing scammers. When you give you money to scumbags like Giants Software you degrade the entire gaming industray, pay for this crap today and tomorrow you'll only be able to buy crap like this. 

THE GAME IS SO BAD! 

NEVER EVER BUY FROM:
Giants Software

Performance is awful, my RTX5080 cant manage more than 30fps in this game.
Every forum post about the games terrible performance tells me to edit xml files, change driver defaults, enter console commands. It should not be this complicated, nothing makes it better.
Stutters and framedrops into the single digits if I try to move too fast, just completely unopimised.
You do so much work for literal shit, I spent 2 hours getting my crop and still lost money. There is 0 progression.

There are 3 main issues I have with this game:

1. You can't sell fences. I placed fences all around the perimeter of my 3 farm houses to make the property look neater and divide the 3 areas. Then I realized it ended up costing way too much money, and when I went to sell them (like you can do with every other item in the construction tab) you only get the option to demolish them. So that was $50,000 of in-game money down the drain, and couldn't load a new save. So I never use fences in fear that I'll regret placing them, not to mention they're very expensive.

2. You have to constantly watch the tractor to make sure it doesn't go off track leave small sections of unharvested/mowed crops on your field. It would be great if there was a key you could press that would let you run the tractor parallel to the last line you made. The only way to make field work anything but tedious is to just hire the AI farmer and take the loss in funds.

3. There's an incredibly steep learning curve and many things the tutorial doesn't teach you. The first three hours of the game are spent on researching what kind of equipment you need for what type of crop you are growing, and then spending a significant amount of time transporting the equipment from the store to your farm. And by the time you have your farm set up and are ready to actually play, you've lost a lot of time and enthusiasm.

I love farming games, and this game can be fun sometimes, especially when you finally have enough money to construct a new building or get new farm animals. But for the most part, this game is very boring and tedious and it takes forever to make progress in the game.
As always. Confusing DLC layouts. Will pirate the rest of the DLC

Countless bugs and unfinished game functionality plague what would have otherwise been a great game. The company has just gotten sloppier with their game quality with every major release of this game. I won't be buying any future releases.

There is literally zero effort put into the game to make your landing smooth. No tutorials, nothing. You're dropped in the middle of nowhere with a bunch of questions marks with a lot of text to read.
Even after so many DLCs, not even a lousy introduction to game mechanics and controls is unacceptable this days. Even Indy games on early access provide some sort of tutorial to get you started as fast as possible. Not this game though.
If there is no effort to make my landing is smoother,
I value my time too much, to have to go on a hunt just to get started.
This game deserves as much respect as it shows towards my time.

asked giants why i couldn't purchase bundles if i have the base game, and they told me to piss off, and that bundles weren't available to people that have the base game. when it's cheaper for a new player to get access to the DLCs than someone who's had the game for years, it's a problem.
I cant launch it and spent 1 hour playing and 5 hours trouble shooting and i cant even get my damn money back what a load of bs
optimization is needed to call this a game but hey, its the only game of its kind so i have to stick with this or do it irl

game will not open at all. it opens from the previous version, however this one is outdated and does not include the full mod list. i have tried contacting support about this however there is no response. i really did enjoy this game, when i could play it, however in its current unplayable state, i have to give it a negative review as what use is owning a game you cant play

There are 3 main issues I have with this game:

1. You can't sell fences. I placed fences all around the perimeter of my 3 farm houses to make the property look neater and divide the 3 areas. Then I realized it ended up costing way too much money, and when I went to sell them (like you can do with every other item in the construction tab) you only get the option to demolish them. So that was $50,000 of in-game money down the drain, and couldn't load a new save. So I never use fences in fear that I'll regret placing them, not to mention they're very expensive.

2. You have to constantly watch the tractor to make sure it doesn't go off track leave small sections of unharvested/mowed crops on your field. It would be great if there was a key you could press that would let you run the tractor parallel to the last line you made. The only way to make field work anything but tedious is to just hire the AI farmer and take the loss in funds.

3. There's an incredibly steep learning curve and many things the tutorial doesn't teach you. The first three hours of the game are spent on researching what kind of equipment you need for what type of crop you are growing, and then spending a significant amount of time transporting the equipment from the store to your farm. And by the time you have your farm set up and are ready to actually play, you've lost a lot of time and enthusiasm.

I love farming games, and this game can be fun sometimes, especially when you finally have enough money to construct a new building or get new farm animals. But for the most part, this game is very boring and tedious and it takes forever to make progress in the game.
As always. Confusing DLC layouts. Will pirate the rest of the DLC

There are 3 main issues I have with this game:

1. You can't sell fences. I placed fences all around the perimeter of my 3 farm houses to make the property look neater and divide the 3 areas. Then I realized it ended up costing way too much money, and when I went to sell them (like you can do with every other item in the construction tab) you only get the option to demolish them. So that was $50,000 of in-game money down the drain, and couldn't load a new save. So I never use fences in fear that I'll regret placing them, not to mention they're very expensive.

2. You have to constantly watch the tractor to make sure it doesn't go off track leave small sections of unharvested/mowed crops on your field. It would be great if there was a key you could press that would let you run the tractor parallel to the last line you made. The only way to make field work anything but tedious is to just hire the AI farmer and take the loss in funds.

3. There's an incredibly steep learning curve and many things the tutorial doesn't teach you. The first three hours of the game are spent on researching what kind of equipment you need for what type of crop you are growing, and then spending a significant amount of time transporting the equipment from the store to your farm. And by the time you have your farm set up and are ready to actually play, you've lost a lot of time and enthusiasm.

I love farming games, and this game can be fun sometimes, especially when you finally have enough money to construct a new building or get new farm animals. But for the most part, this game is very boring and tedious and it takes forever to make progress in the game.

2. You have to constantly watch the tractor to make sure it doesn't go off track leave small sections of unharvested/mowed crops on your field. It would be great if there was a key you could press that would let you run the tractor parallel to the last line you made. The only way to make field work anything but tedious is to just hire the AI farmer and take the loss in funds.

3. There's an incredibly steep learning curve and many things the tutorial doesn't teach you. The first three hours of the game are spent on researching what kind of equipment you need for what type of crop you are growing, and then spending a significant amount of time transporting the equipment from the store to your farm. And by the time you have your farm set up and are ready to actually play, you've lost a lot of time and enthusiasm.

I love farming games, and this game can be fun sometimes, especially when you finally have enough money to construct a new building or get new farm animals. But for the most part, this game is very boring and tedious and it takes forever to make progress in the game.
As always. Confusing DLC layouts. Will pirate the rest of the DLC

Countless bugs and unfinished game functionality plague what would have otherwise been a great game. The company has just gotten sloppier with their game quality with every major release of this game. I won't be buying any future releases.

There is literally zero effort put into the game to make your landing smooth. No tutorials, nothing. You're dropped in the middle of nowhere with a bunch of questions marks with a lot of text to read.
Even after so many DLCs, not even a lousy introduction to game mechanics and controls is unacceptable this days. Even Indy games on early access provide some sort of tutorial to get you started as fast as possible. Not this game though.
If there is no effort to make my landing is smoother,
I value my time too much, to have to go on a hunt just to get started.
This game deserves as much respect as it shows towards my time.

There are 3 main issues I have with this game:

1. You can't sell fences. I placed fences all around the perimeter of my 3 farm houses to make the property look neater and divide the 3 areas. Then I realized it ended up costing way too much money, and when I went to sell them (like you can do with every other item in the construction tab) you only get the option to demolish them. So that was $50,000 of in-game money down the drain, and couldn't load a new save. So I never use fences in fear that I'll regret placing them, not to mention they're very expensive.

2. You have to constantly watch the tractor to make sure it doesn't go off track leave small sections of unharvested/mowed crops on your field. It would be great if there was a key you could press that would let you run the tractor parallel to the last line you made. The only way to make field work anything but tedious is to just hire the AI farmer and take the loss in funds.

3. There's an incredibly steep learning curve and many things the tutorial doesn't teach you. The first three hours of the game are spent on researching what kind of equipment you need for what type of crop you are growing, and then spending a significant amount of time transporting the equipment from the store to your farm. And by the time you have your farm set up and are ready to actually play, you've lost a lot of time and enthusiasm.

I love farming games, and this game can be fun sometimes, especially when you finally have enough money to construct a new building or get new farm animals. But for the most part, this game is very boring and tedious and it takes forever to make progress in the game.
As always. Confusing DLC layouts. Will pirate the rest of the DLC
